case_title: Members Raja NAVED AHMED vs MEMBER-I, BOARD OF REVENUE, BALUCHISTAN and 2 others

accussed_details.name: Raja Naved Ahmed
allegation: Failure to pass departmental examination for confirmation

accussed_details.name: Mohammad Hayat
allegation: Requirement to pass departmental examination for confirmation

complaint_summary: Appellants challenged the requirement to pass departmental examinations for confirmation under the Baluchistan Service Rules, 1980, claiming eligibility for automatic confirmation under the West Pakistan Tehsildari and Naib-Tehsildari Service Rules, 1962.
investigation_summary: Appellants were required to appear in departmental examinations conducted by the Public Service Commission. Raja Naved Ahmed failed two papers, while Mohammad Hayat passed the examination.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal dismissed the appeals, holding that the appellants were not automatically confirmed under the Rules of 1962 or 1980. The requirement to pass departmental examinations was deemed valid under the Baluchistan Civil Servants Act, 1974.
legal_arguments: Appellants argued that Explanation II of Rule 10 of the Rules of 1962 provided automatic confirmation after probation expiry.
Respondents argued that departmental examinations were mandatory under Rule 10(4) of the Rules of 1962 and Rule 8 of the Rules of 1980.
Tribunal held that Ordinance III of 1983 validly amended Section 7 of the Baluchistan Civil Servants Act, 1974, removing automatic confirmation provisions.
statutes: West Pakistan Tehsildari and Naib-Tehsildari Service Rules, 1962
sections: Section 6(1) of Baluchistan Civil Servants Act, 1974
Rule 10(3) and Rule 10(4) of Rules of 1962
key_issues: Validity of departmental examination requirement for confirmation
Impact of Ordinance III of 1983 on vested rights
Interpretation of deeming clauses in service rules

maxims.Retrospective Legislation: Legislation may operate retrospectively unless it takes away vested rights without express words or necessary intendment.

legal_terms.Probation: A period during which a civil servant's performance is evaluated before confirmation.
legal_terms.Confirmation: Formal acceptance of a civil servant into permanent service.

words_and_phrases.Deeming Clause: A legal fiction that treats an imaginary state of affairs as real for statutory purposes.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the appellants' challenge to the requirement of passing departmental examinations for confirmation under the Baluchistan Service Rules, 1980. The Tribunal upheld the validity of the requirement, citing relevant statutes and precedents, and dismissed the appeals.
